verses.verse: (A Shiggaion <S%H7692><s%> of David, which he sang to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> concerning Cush, a Benjamite.) O Lord my God, <S%H430><s%> in Thee I have taken <S%H2620><s%> refuge; <S%H2620><s%> Save <S%H3467><s%> me from all <S%H3605><s%> those who pursue <S%H7291><s%> me, and deliver <S%H5337><s%> me,

Lest <S%H6435><s%> he tear <S%H2963><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> like a lion, <S%H9030><s%> Dragging <S%H6561><s%> me away, <S%H6561><s%> while there <S%H369><s%> is none <S%H369><s%> to deliver. <S%H5337><s%>
O Lord <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> if <S%H518><s%> I have done <S%H6213><s%> this, <S%H384><s%> If <S%H518><s%> there <S%H3426><s%> is injustice <S%H5766><s%> in my hands, <S%H3709><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> I have rewarded <S%H1580><s%> evil <S%H9563><s%> to my friend, <S%H7999><s%> Or have plundered <S%H2502><s%> him who without <S%H7387><s%> cause <S%H7387><s%> was my adversary, <S%H6887><s%>

Let the enemy <S%H340><s%> pursue <S%H7291><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> and overtake <S%H5381><s%> [it]; And let him trample <S%H7429><s%> my life <S%H9132><s%> down <S%H7429><s%> to the ground, <S%H776><s%> And lay <S%H7931><s%> my glory <S%H9202><s%> in the dust. <S%H6083><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

Arise, <S%H6965><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> in Thine anger; <S%H639><s%> Lift <S%H5375><s%> up Thyself against the rage <S%H5678><s%> of my adversaries, <S%H6887><s%> And arouse <S%H5782><s%> Thyself for me; Thou hast appointed <S%H6680><s%> judgment. <S%H4941><s%>
And let the assembly <S%H5712><s%> of the peoples <S%H3816><s%> encompass <S%H5437><s%> Thee; And over <S%H5921><s%> them return <S%H7725><s%> Thou on high. <S%H4791><s%>

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> judges <S%H1777><s%> the peoples; <S%H5971><s%> Vindicate <S%H8199><s%> me, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> according to my righteousness <S%H6664><s%> and my integrity <S%H8537><s%> that is in me.

O <S%H4994><s%> let the evil <S%H9563><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> come <S%H1584><s%> to an end, <S%H1584><s%> but establish <S%H3559><s%> the righteous; <S%H6662><s%> For the righteous <S%H6662><s%> God <S%H430><s%> tries <S%H974><s%> the hearts <S%H3820><s%> and minds. <S%H3629><s%>
My shield <S%H4043><s%> is with God, <S%H430><s%> Who saves <S%H3467><s%> the upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart. <S%H3820><s%>
God <S%H430><s%> is a righteous <S%H6662><s%> judge, <S%H8199><s%> And a God <S%H410><s%> who has indignation <S%H2194><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> a man does not repent, <S%H7725><s%> He will sharpen <S%H3913><s%> His sword; <S%H2719><s%> He has bent <S%H1869><s%> His bow <S%H7198><s%> and made <S%H3559><s%> it ready. <S%H3559><s%>
He has also prepared <S%H3559><s%> for Himself deadly <S%H4194><s%> weapons; <S%H3627><s%> He makes <S%H6466><s%> His arrows <S%H2671><s%> fiery <S%H1814><s%> shafts. <S%H1814><s%>

Behold, <S%H2009><s%> he travails <S%H9111><s%> with wickedness, <S%H205><s%> And he conceives <S%H2029><s%> mischief, <S%H5999><s%> and brings <S%H3205><s%> forth <S%H3205><s%> falsehood. <S%H8267><s%>
He has dug <S%H3738><s%> a pit <S%H953><s%> and hollowed <S%H2658><s%> it out, And has fallen <S%H5307><s%> into the hole <S%H7845><s%> which he made. <S%H6466><s%>
His mischief <S%H5999><s%> will return <S%H7725><s%> upon his own head, <S%H7218><s%> And his violence <S%H2555><s%> will descend <S%H3381><s%> upon his own pate. <S%H6936><s%>

I will give <S%H3034><s%> thanks <S%H3034><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> according to His righteousness, <S%H6664><s%> And will sing <S%H2167><s%> praise <S%H2167><s%> to the name <S%H8034><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> Most <S%H9411><s%> High. <S%H9411><s%>
